title: `git doesn't contain any tags` when using semver sorting

labels.name: docs
labels.description: A problem or enhancement in documentation

body:
### What happened?

When I modify my https://github.com/celestiaorg/celestia-app/blob/main/.goreleaser.yaml to use [semver sorting](https://goreleaser.com/customization/git/#semver-sorting) then GoReleaser fails to create a release because

```
⨯ release failed after 0s                          error=git doesn't contain any tags. Either add a tag or use --snapshot
```

### How can we reproduce this?

1. Check out [this branch](https://github.com/celestiaorg/celestia-app/tree/rp/goreleaser-semver) or fork that repo and modify https://github.com/celestiaorg/celestia-app/blob/main/.goreleaser.yaml to have this diff:

    ```diff
    git:
      prerelease_suffix: "-rc*"
      tag_sort: semver
    ```
1. Run `make  prebuilt-binary`

    ```shell
    $ make prebuilt-binary
    docker run \
		    --rm \
		    -e CGO_ENABLED=1 \
		    --env-file .release-env \
		    -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
		    -v `pwd`:/go/src/github.com/celestiaorg/celestia-app/v3 \
		    -w /go/src/github.com/celestiaorg/celestia-app/v3 \
		    ghcr.io/goreleaser/goreleaser-cross:v1.22.6 \
		    release --clean
    WARNING! Your password will be stored unencrypted in /root/.docker/config.json.
    Configure a credential helper to remove this warning. See
    https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/login/#credential-stores
    
    Login Succeeded
    WARNING! Your password will be stored unencrypted in /root/.docker/config.json.
    Configure a credential helper to remove this warning. See
    https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/login/#credential-stores
    
    Login Succeeded
      • loading environment variables
        • using token from  $GITHUB_TOKEN
      • getting and validating git state
      ⨯ release failed after 0s                          error=git doesn't contain any tags. Either add a tag or use --snapshot
    make: *** [prebuilt-binary] Error 1
    ```

### Additional context

I thought my local git version may have impacted this so I upgraded from git version 2.39.0 => 2.46.0. I don't know what git version is running in the goreleaser-cross Docker container.

Related but I don't expect this to cause the issue, VSCode complains that semver isn't a valid option
